resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
raulcd opened a new pull request, #13129:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13129

   This PR tries to update and make consistent our linting for Python between archery and pre-commit by removing the checks for cython files. Flake8 does not support Cython linting, see [this conversation](https://github.com/PyCQA/flake8/issues/1482) for more details.

pitrou closed pull request #13129: ARROW-16531: [Dev] Update pre-commit to use latest flake8 and remove unsupported cython linting
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13129

ursabot commented on PR #13129:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13129#issuecomment-1127691820

   Benchmark runs are scheduled for baseline = 40456a8731139e8bb6c3cbb07aefe8add3173137 and contender = 940ab93af6a6496d294c5a3f70709bde597ca548. 940ab93af6a6496d294c5a3f70709bde597ca548 is a master commit associated with this PR. Results will be available as each benchmark for each run completes.

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
It seems there are some legitimate linting errors in master.

{noformat}
(arrow-dev) pace@pace-desktop:~/dev/arrow$ archery lint --python
INFO:archery:Running Python formatter (autopep8)
INFO:archery:Running Python linter (flake8)
/home/pace/dev/arrow/python/pyarrow/_parquet.pyx:156:80: E501 line too long (80 > 79 characters)
/home/pace/dev/arrow/python/pyarrow/_parquet.pyx:170:80: E501 line too long (80 > 79 characters)
/home/pace/dev/arrow/python/pyarrow/_parquet.pyx:242:77: W291 trailing whitespace
/home/pace/dev/arrow/python/pyarrow/_parquet.pyx:447:80: E501 line too long (80 > 79 characters)
/home/pace/dev/arrow/python/pyarrow/_parquet.pyx:447:81: W291 trailing whitespace
...
{noformat}
fields.summary: [Python] Lint rules do not seem to be getting enforced

comments.body: I've attached the full list of errors.  They seem to all come from pyx/pxi/etc. files so I wonder if the lint step is maybe missing these files.
It's possible that {{flake8}} isn't running on these files. cc [~raulcd]

It seems it is not running the linter on these files. I am slightly confused though because it does not seem to run locally either for me so I can't really reproduce [~westonpace] issue:
{code:java}
(pyarrow-dev) raulcd@rhaegar ~/arrow (master) $ archery lint --python
INFO:archery:Running Python formatter (autopep8)
INFO:archery:Running Python linter (flake8)
(pyarrow-dev) raulcd@rhaegar ~/arrow (master) $ 
{code}
I'll keep investigating on why flake8 doesn't seem to check the cython files.

I have seen this recently with the pre-commit flake8 print check as well.

If I make a tiny change to {{_parquet.pyx}} and commit this:

{code}
$ git commit -am "test"
[WARNING] Unexpected key(s) present on git://github.com/pre-commit/pre-commit-hooks: sha
Release Audit Tool.......................................................Passed
Docker Format........................................(no files to check)Skipped
Python Format........................................(no files to check)Skipped
Cython Format............................................................Failed
- hook id: flake8
- exit code: 1

python/pyarrow/_parquet.pyx:156:80: E501 line too long (80 > 79 characters)
python/pyarrow/_parquet.pyx:170:80: E501 line too long (80 > 79 characters)
python/pyarrow/_parquet.pyx:242:77: W291 trailing whitespace
python/pyarrow/_parquet.pyx:447:80: E501 line too long (80 > 79 characters)
python/pyarrow/_parquet.pyx:447:81: W291 trailing whitespace
python/pyarrow/_parquet.pyx:457:80: E501 line too long (88 > 79 characters)
python/pyarrow/_parquet.pyx:464:80: E501 line too long (82 > 79 characters)
python/pyarrow/_parquet.pyx:597:80: E501 line too long (90 > 79 characters)
python/pyarrow/_parquet.pyx:738:80: E501 line too long (89 > 79 characters)
python/pyarrow/_parquet.pyx:1011:80: E501 line too long (89 > 79 characters)
python/pyarrow/_parquet.pyx:1693:15: W291 trailing whitespace
{code}

It does seem flake8 was not supposed to work with cython and does not seem to be a supported feature for new Flake8 versions. See this thread:
https://github.com/PyCQA/flake8/issues/1482
Regardless, it's weird that people get lint errors in some setups but not others.

I agree. The issue is, our pre-commit configuration is using an old version of flake8 that is checking cython. I suppose [~westonpace] has an old version (pre flake8==4.0.1) on its virtualenv which is still checking these files. Newer versions of flake8 won't support it (based on the flake8 repo conversation I linked).

I think we have a couple of possibilites:
 * pin an old version of flake8 so we continue with the old checks.
 * Update the pre-commit version to use the latest flake8 and pin the archery dependency to use the latest flake8 and find a different way of linting the cython files (at least line length)

I think we should upgrade our pre-commit hook to update to use recent flake8. When doing that locally I also don't see any cython related failures anymore (as expected, as flake8 doesn't lint that anymore)
See https://flake8.pycqa.org/en/latest/user/using-hooks.html#usage-with-the-pre-commit-git-hooks-framework for what flake8 itself recommends for pre-commit

Yeah, we cannot rely for years on an outdated version of flake8, unfortunately.

As a sidenote, the amount of hostility displayed by the authors of flake8 is staggering. According to [this message|https://github.com/PyCQA/flake8/issues/1482#issuecomment-985891574], people linting Cython with flake8 were "abusers".

I have created a PR for this ticket to update the pre-commit hook and remove the cython linting config from flake8, as it is not supposed to work. I have also created a new ticket to find some way of linting cython separately: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-16544

Let me know if that sounds ok.
Yikes.  Thanks for looking into this.  I can upgrade my flake8.
